title: Executive Order 8220-Partial Revocation of Certain Executive Orders Creating Temporary Power-Site Withdrawals and Power-Site Reserves
content: By virtue of and pursuant to the authority vested in me by the act of June 25, 1910, c. 421, 36 Stat. 847, as amended by the act of August 24, 1912, c. 369, 37 Stat. 497, it is hereby ordered as follows:

1. The Executive order of December 30, 1909, withdrawing lands for Temporary Power-Site Withdrawal No. 66, and the Executive order of July 2, 1910, withdrawing lands for Power-Site Reserve No. 66, are hereby revoked as to the following-described lands:
T. 9 S., R. 13 E., sec. 21, SE¼NW¼NW¼.

2. The Executive order of December 30, 1909, withdrawing lands for Temporary Power-Site Withdrawal No. 95, and the Executive Order of July 2, 1910, withdrawing lands for Power-Site Reserve No. 95, are hereby revoked as to the following-described lands:
T. 17 S., R. 4 E., sec. 6, lot 1.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 8220-Partial Revocation of Certain Executive Orders Creating Temporary Power-Site Withdrawals and Power-Site Reserves Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/368701
